title: Research Assistant in Computational Mechanics of Composite Structures
text:
★ View Employer Profile 
Based in the Department of Aerospace Engineering you will carry out fundamental research on structural efficiency for wind turbine structures, joining Professor Weaver’s Composite Structures group. You will have opportunity to work with this team as well as international partners under various programmes. 
Expertise in spectral methods and functional analysis as applied to composite structures is essential. You will have a first degree in an Engineering based discipline and hold PhD (or have submitted) in the field of computational mechanics. This post is being offered on a full time, open-ended post, funded initially for 1 year. Informal enquiries can be made to: Professor Paul Weaver Paul.Weaver@bristol.ac.uk 
The University of Bristol is committed to equality and we value the diversity of our staff and students Share this job
